meanings.definition: To weaken or damage the base or foundation of something.
meanings.sent1: The heavy rain was undermining the walls of the old house.
meanings.sent2: The constant criticism was undermining her self-esteem.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy kept undermining the sandcastle by digging around it.
meanings.sent4: The rumors were undermining the stability of the company like termites in wood.
meanings.sent5: The erosion was slowly undermining the cliff, causing it to crumble into the sea.

meanings.definition: To gradually weaken or destroy someone's confidence or trust.
meanings.sent1: His constant teasing was undermining her belief in herself.
meanings.sent2: The dishonest behavior of the politician was undermining public trust.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was undermining the trust of the other animals by stealing their nuts.
meanings.sent4: The lies were undermining their friendship, creating a rift between them.
meanings.sent5: The repeated failures were undermining his determination to succeed.

meanings.definition: To dig or tunnel beneath something, causing it to collapse.
meanings.sent1: The burrowing animals were undermining the stability of the garden path.
meanings.sent2: The miners were undermining the mountain to extract precious minerals.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky mole was undermining the farmer's efforts by tunneling under the crops.
meanings.sent4: The enemy soldiers were undermining the castle walls to weaken the defense.
meanings.sent5: The relentless digging was undermining the structural integrity of the building.
